#36198 seems to report the same exception, however, I opened a new PR because
of a different Eclipse version (3.0M5) and what I would consider a new angle
on the reason of failure.

Here are steps to reproduce:

I created an "all tests in the selected project" JUnit run configuration.
The project against which it should be run is "com.jpl.classdep-test".
The following exception occurs:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
junit/framework/TestListener
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:502)
	at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:123)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:250)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:54)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:193)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:299)
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:265)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:255)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:315)


Now to the interesting part:

1. When I run a single test from the same project, it works.
2. The ClassDefNotFoundError for the "all tests" configuration only
occurs if the greyed out "Project:" text field under "Run a single test"
contains a project other than "com.jpl.classdep-test" (specifically,
"com.jpl.classdep"). If I set the radio to "single test", edit the "Project:"
text field to be "com.jpl.classdep-test", then set the radio back to
"all tests", I do not get the error.

Therefore, the main issue addressed in this report is:

Why does the content of a disabled (greyed out) text field in a JUnit run
configuration have ANY effect on the execution? IMO, it should be completely
ignored.

(Note that even when the error does not occur, there is still another problem:
too many tests are picked up, which I described in detail in #38617 - still
open. I was quiet on that another PR because somehow I got it working properly
in 2.1.x. Now I am migrating to 3.0 and running against the same problem again.)
This should have been fixed for RC3
